pr_body:
Support for .cvmfsbundles files

To improve cold cache loading, a new content type, bundle, is introduced
([PR 2741](https://github.com/cvmfs/cvmfs/pull/2741)). The bundle has a binary format of an object pack

A bundle specification file, named `.cvmfsbundles`, allows the creation of such
bundles on the server-side. The `.cvfmsbundles` file is maintained by the
repository owners. During publication, the bundles are created and
stored according to the contents of this file.

This PR will
 * allow recognition of the bundle specification files on the server-side.
 * enforce the requirement that such files must be regular and not a hard link.
     Additionally, ensure that the file is in the root directory of a repository.
 * reserve the filename, `.cvmfsbundles`, for the bundle specification files. 

Corresponding JIRA issue: [CVM-1886](https://sft.its.cern.ch/jira/browse/CVM-1886)

pr_title: Introduce bundles content type in the repository
pr_body:
Introduce bundles content type

To improve cold cache loading, several files which are known to be required in sets can be bundled together and streamed as an object pack. This is the case, for instance, for well-known Python libraries (e.g. Tensorflow) that upon start always load a certain set of inter-dependent python files.

To support this, a new content type *bundles* is introduced. A bundle can have the binary format of object packs used by the gateway as a form to concatenate multiple objects in a single BLOB. Such bundles would be created using a special hidden file (.cvmfsbundles in [draft PR 2736](https://github.com/cvmfs/cvmfs/pull/2736)). Bundle files can be chunked the same way regular large files get chunked. Chunked and non-chunked bundle files would get a B as a hash suffix.

Corresponding JIRA issue: [CVM-1886](https://sft.its.cern.ch/jira/browse/CVM-1886)

pr_title: Extend catalog table to support bundle files
pr_body:
Extend the catalog table

The catalog table in the file catalogs needs an additional column that specifies a bundle ID that can be optionally associated with a regular file.
An additional file catalog table will register the bundles (or the respective bundle chunks) and their IDs

Corresponding JIRA issue: [CVM-1886](https://sft.its.cern.ch/jira/browse/CVM-1886)

pr_title: Add client-side support for bundle files
pr_body:
Bundle files would allow improving cold cache loading of certain sets files that are known to be required if any of the files in the set is accessed. The Bundle files would be created on the server-side according to `.cvmfsbundles` files

On the client-side when there is a cache miss for a file that is part of a bundle, the file catalog can be checked for the list of files part of that bundle. So the client can then decide based on the cache contents whether to download the individual requested file or the entire bundle. Being an object pack, the bundle would be directly streamed into the local cache.

For more background please refer to [CVM-1886](https://sft.its.cern.ch/jira/browse/CVM-1886)
